medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 5 weeks prior with sore throat, subjective fever, malaise, and diffuse myalgias. After a clinical diagnosis of streptococcal pharyngitis and treatment with penicillin, symptoms of fatigue and worsening myalgias developed in the following weeks. A positive throat culture for group A beta-hemolytic streptococcus occurred 15 days post initial symptoms with persistent myalgias and malaise. Shortly after, the patient developed shortness of breath and chest pain that worsened with deep inspiration. Symptoms persisted despite treatment.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's brother recently died at 32 years of age from intravenous-drug use that was complicated by fungal endocarditis with an abscess of the mitral-valve ring.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a college student who lives with roommates, is sexually active with consistent condom use, and smokes marijuana approximately two times per month while drinking five or six beers once per week. He had no exposure to animals and had not traveled outside New England in the past 4 years. He does not use tobacco.
